item.title: 韩国监管机构命令韩华航空航天重新提交股票发行计划
item.description: 韩国金融监管机构周四下令韩华宇航再次提交股票发行计划修订稿，第二次推迟了这家韩国最大国防承包商的集资计划。【原文：South Korea's financial watchdog ordered on Thursday Hanwha Aerospace to submit another revision to its share issue plan, pushing back on the capital raising plans of the country's largest defence contractor for a second time.】

item.title: 贸易战、鲍威尔言论拖累股市和美元走势
item.description: 在美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔警告关税导致经济增长放缓和物价上涨的风险后，亚洲股市周四出现震荡，而美国贸易政策的不确定性使美元继续在三年低点附近徘徊。【原文：Asian stocks wavered on Thursday after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell warned of the risk of slowing growth and rising prices due to tariffs, while the uncertainty around U.S. trade policies kept the dollar rooted near three-year lows.】

item.title: 投资者翘首以待台积电财报，芯片股面临试金石考验
item.description: 投资者正密切关注台湾台积电周四公布的财报，该财报将进一步证明美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的贸易政策给芯片行业带来的广泛不确定性。【原文：Investors are bracing for the results from Taiwan's TSMC on Thursday to show further evidence of the wide-ranging uncertainty in the chip industry spurred by U.S. President Donald Trump's trade policies.】

item.title: 不丹利用 "绿色 "加密货币推动经济发展
item.description: 喜马拉雅山国家不丹的主权财富基金首席执行官表示，不丹正在探索利用水电开采和利用绿色加密货币的方法，以促进经济发展和创造就业机会，减少人才流失。【原文：The Himalayan nation of Bhutan is exploring ways to mine and leverage green cryptocurrencies using hydropower to boost its economy and create jobs to reduce brain drain, the chief executive of its sovereign wealth fund said.】

item.title: 据 The Information 报道，TikTok 的美国公共政策主管将辞职
item.description: 据 The Information 周三援引一份员工备忘录报道，TikTok 的美国公共政策主管迈克尔-贝克曼（Michael Beckerman）计划离开他在华盛顿的职位，转而担任全球顾问。【原文：TikTok's U.S. public policy chief, Michael Beckerman, a key figure in its fight against a U.S. government ban, plans to leave his Washington-based role and transition to a global advisory position, The Information reported on Wednesday, citing a staff memo.】

item.title: 亚洲国家希望购买更多美国能源以抵消贸易失衡
item.description: 亚洲各国政府正在寻求购买更多的美国石油和天然气，因为它们正竭力降低与华盛顿的贸易顺差，希望减轻唐纳德-特朗普总统全面征收新进口关税给它们带来的关税负担。【原文：Asian governments are looking to buy more U.S. oil and gas as they scramble to lower their trade surplus with Washington in hopes of easing their tariff burdens under President Donald Trump's sweeping new import duties.】

item.title: 日本 Zeon 公司将在夏季前决定对美投资，认为特朗普关税带来的风险正在上升
item.description: 日本化学公司 Zeon 的首席执行官表示，该公司计划在今年夏天之前决定是否继续推进其搁置的在美国扩大生产的计划。【原文：Japanese chemical company Zeon aims to decide by the summer whether to move forward with plans it put on hold to expand production in the United States, its CEO said.】

item.title: 中国表示将无视美国的 "关税数字游戏
item.description: 中国外交部周四表示，如果美国继续玩 "关税数字游戏"，中国将不予理睬，此前白宫概述了中国如何因其报复行动而面临高达 245% 的关税。【原文：China will pay no attention if the United States continues to play the "tariff numbers game", China's foreign ministry said on Thursday, after the White House outline how China faces tariffs of up to 245% due to its retaliatory actions.】

item.title: 日本央行上田称美国关税不确定性急剧上升
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫周五表示，围绕美国政策，尤其是关税政策的不确定性最近急剧上升。【原文：Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda said on Friday uncertainty surrounding U.S. policy, particularly that on tariffs, has heightened sharply recently.】

item.title: 美元滑向复活节周末
item.description: 美元兑日元汇率从七个月低点回升，原因是美日贸易谈判迄今未就货币问题进行任何讨论。【原文：The dollar looked set to notch a fourth straight weekly loss on Thursday as tariffs drive investors from U.S. assets, though it lifted off a seven-month low against the yen as U.S.-Japan trade talks have so far steered clear of any currency discussion.】

item.title: 特朗普关税加剧经济风险，韩国维持利率不变
item.description: 韩国央行周四一如预期维持政策利率不变，这一决定旨在帮助疲软的韩元，因为华盛顿试图通过征收全面关税来调整全球贸易秩序，这有可能损害经济增长。【原文：South Korea's central bank left its policy interest rate unchanged as expected on Thursday, a decision designed to aid a wobbly won as Washington's attempts to reorder global trade by imposing sweeping tariffs threaten to damage economic growth.】

item.title: 美国增加对伊朗的制裁，欧佩克减产，油价每周上涨
item.description: 周四，油价延续涨势，原因是在华盛顿实施进一步制裁以遏制伊朗石油贸易之后，供应有望趋紧，而且一些欧佩克产油国承诺进一步减产，以弥补超过商定配额的抽油量。【原文：Oil prices extended gains on Thursday on the prospect of tighter supply after Washington imposed further sanctions to curb Iranian oil trade and as some OPEC producers pledged further output cuts to compensate for pumping above agreed quotas.】

item.title: 瓦莱罗公司计提 11 亿美元减值损失，可能闲置加州炼油厂
item.description: 瓦莱罗能源公司（Valero Energy Corp）周三表示，将对其加州炼油厂计提 11 亿美元的税前减值，并告知州监管机构，将在 2026 年 4 月底之前永久关闭或重组其位于加州贝尼西亚的旧金山地区炼油厂。【原文：Valero Energy Corp said on Wednesday it was taking a $1.1 billion pre-tax impairment related to its California refineries and told state regulators it would permanently shut or restructure its San Francisco-area refinery in Benicia, California by the end of April 2026.】

item.title: 美联储施密德称需要耐心等待关税结果
item.description: 堪萨斯城联邦储备银行行长杰夫-施密德（Jeff Schmid）周三表示，美联储的政策决策面临着复杂的局面，他指出，虽然他听到了农业部门对关税的紧张情绪，但近期能源价格的下跌可能会带来一剂 "强心针"，在一定程度上限制通胀。【原文：The Federal Reserve faces a complicated picture for policy decisions, Kansas City Federal Reserve Bank President Jeff Schmid said on Wednesday, noting that while he is hearing nervousness about tariffs in the agricultural sector, a recent decline in energy prices may deliver an offsetting "shot in the arm" that could somewhat limit inflation.】

item.title: Insignia 延长贝恩和 CC Capital 竞购的排他性窗口期
item.description: 澳大利亚 Insignia Financial 公司周四表示，该公司已将其竞标者贝恩资本（Bain Capital）和 CC Capital Partners 的排他性期限延长了四周，以便他们考虑收购这家财富管理公司的建议。【原文：Australia's Insignia Financial said on Thursday that it has extended the exclusivity period by four weeks for both its bidders, Bain Capital and CC Capital Partners, to consider their proposals to acquire the wealth manager.】

item.title: 日本 3 月份出口在美国加征关税前扩大
item.description: 周四的数据显示，日本 3 月份出口连续第六个月增长，原因是美国全面关税的威胁促使日本公司增加了汽车和电子零部件的出货量。【原文：Japan's exports rose for a sixth straight month in March, data showed on Thursday, as the threat of sweeping U.S. tariffs drove Japanese companies to ramp up shipments of cars and electronic parts.】

item.title: 美国关税紧张局势下习近平访柬，柬埔寨期待中国提供更多帮助
item.description: 柬埔寨政府发言人表示，中国国家主席习近平将于本周四结束东南亚三国之行访问柬埔寨，柬埔寨希望得到中国更多的财政支持，包括基础设施方面的支持。【原文：Cambodia is betting on more financial support from China, including for infrastructure, as President Xi Jinping visits the country on Thursday at the end of a three-nation trip in Southeast Asia, a Cambodian government spokesman said.】

item.title: 日本 3 月出口同比增长 3.9
item.description: 日本财务省周四公布的数据显示，日本 3 月份出口同比增长 3.9%，连续第六个月增长。【原文：Japanese exports rose 3.9% year-on-year in March, up for a sixth straight month, data from the Ministry of Finance showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 澳大利亚桑托斯公司第一季度销售收入下降 7
item.description: 澳大利亚石油和天然气生产商桑托斯公司（Santos）周四公布的第一季度销售收入下降了7%，原因是原油销售量下降，以及国内天然气和与石油挂钩的液化天然气销售合同的实际价格疲软。【原文：Australian oil and gas producer Santos posted a 7% fall in first-quarter sales revenue on Thursday, hurt by lower crude sales volumes and weak realised prices for domestic gas and oil-linked LNG sales contracts.】

item.title: 在外国大米成为关税话题之前，越来越多的日本人开始接受外国大米
item.description: 去年，严重的大米短缺导致日本大米价格飞涨，东京餐馆老板平野 Arata 做了一件以前看来不可思议的事：他改用美国品种的大米。【原文：When a severe rice shortage sent prices skyrocketing in Japan last year, Tokyo restaurant owner Arata Hirano did what had once seemed unthinkable: he switched to an American variety.】

item.title: 美国铝业公司预计第二季度将遭受 9000 万美元的关税打击，对华关税将增加年度成本
item.description: 美国铝业公司（Alcoa）周三表示，预计美国对从加拿大进口的铝征收关税将在本季度给该公司造成约 9000 万美元的损失。【原文：Alcoa said on Wednesday it expects U.S. tariffs on aluminum imports from Canada to cost the company about $90 million in the current quarter.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：CFPB 将减少对企业的处罚力度
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》记者 X 日发布的一份备忘录称，消费者金融保护局首席法律官马克-保莱塔（Mark Paoletta）周三表示，该局将重点解决 "有形伤害 "问题，直接把钱退还给消费者，而不是对公司进行处罚。【原文：Consumer Financial Protection Bureau Chief Legal Officer Mark Paoletta said on Wednesday the bureau will focus on redressing "tangible harm" by getting money back directly to consumers rather than imposing penalties on companies, according to a memo posted by a Wall Street Journal reporter on X.】

item.title: 数据显示，由于关税终止了中国的廉价运输，特姆优、希恩削减了数字广告
item.description: 行业数据显示，美国社交媒体上最大的两家广告商--中国在线市场特步和快时尚零售商Shein正在大幅削减其在美国的数字广告支出，这对Meta's Facebook和YouTube等科技公司是一个打击。【原文：Chinese online marketplace Temu and fast-fashion retailer Shein, two of the biggest advertisers on U.S. social media, are sharply cutting their U.S. digital ad spending, industry data show, in a blow to tech companies such as Meta's Facebook and YouTube.】

item.title: 受关税伤害的股市并未因鲍威尔的言论而有所好转
item.description: 投资者可能一直希望美联储能够帮助受关税影响的市场，但周三美联储总裁却发出了一个不受欢迎的信息：美联储可能陷入困境。【原文：Investors who may have been hoping the Federal Reserve is poised to come to the aid of tariff-rattled markets took away an unwelcome message from the central bank's chief on Wednesday: the Fed may be in a bind.】

item.title: 台积电第一季度利润将大幅增长，但特朗普政策为其前景蒙上阴影
item.description: 台积电（TSMC）是全球人工智能应用领域先进芯片的主要生产商，该公司将于本周四公布第一季度利润增长 57% 的报告，但也可能会指出美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的贸易政策所带来的风险。【原文：TSMC , the main global producer of advanced chips used in artificial intelligence applications, is set to report a 57% leap in first-quarter profit on Thursday, though it is also likely to flag risks from U.S. President Donald Trump's trade policies.】

item.title: 特朗普贸易战波及商界，股市再遭重创
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的全球贸易战的连锁反应正越来越多地同时在众多行业中显现，周三再次对美国股市造成压力，而美国股市已被其反复无常的贸易政策扰动了数周。【原文：The ripple effects of Donald Trump's global trade war are increasingly being felt across numerous industries all at once and on Wednesday were once again exerting pressure on U.S. stock markets that have been roiled for weeks by his erratic trade policies.】

item.title: 煤炭收入下降，铁路运营商 CSX 季度业绩不及预期
item.description: 铁路运营商 CSX 周三公布的第一季度收入和利润低于华尔街预期，原因是联运业务的增长被煤炭收入和燃料附加费的下降所抵消。【原文：Railroad operator CSX reported first-quarter revenue and profit below Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, as gains in intermodal were offset by a decline in coal revenue and fuel surcharge.】

item.title: 消息人士称，前 CISA 负责人 Chris Krebs 在特朗普施压下离开 SentinelOne
item.description: 据两位熟悉内情的消息人士透露，前网络安全和基础设施安全局局长克里斯托弗-克雷布斯（Christopher Krebs）迫于唐纳德-特朗普总统的压力，即将离开网络安全公司 SentinelOne。【原文：Ex-Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency chief Christopher Krebs is leaving cybersecurity company SentinelOne following pressure from President Donald Trump, according to two sources familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 交易日 当筹码减少时
item.description: 交易日【原文：TRADING DAY】

item.title: 鲍威尔认为特朗普的劳工委员会解雇案不适用于美联储
item.description: 美国中央银行行长周三表示，最高法院正在审理的唐纳德-特朗普总统解雇联邦劳工委员会两名民主党人的法律案件不太可能适用于美联储。【原文：The legal case before the Supreme Court over President Donald Trump's firing of two Democrats from federal labor boards does not likely apply to the Federal Reserve, the head of the U.S. central bank said on Wednesday.】
